DataElement.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Version 8.2 Delayed Recall Test Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The score of the Delayed Recall test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Montreal Cognitive Assessment Functional Test Montreal Cognitive Assessment Delayed Recall Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Ziad Nasreddine in 1996 to screen for mild cognitive dysfunction and impairment. This instrument assesses the following cognitive domains: attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation._Five words are read, the test-taker is asked to repeat them, they are read again and asked to repeat again. After completing other tasks, the person is asked to repeat each of the five words again and given a cue of the category that the word belongs to if they are not able to recall them without the cue.

After completing other tasks, the person is asked to repeat each of the five words again and given a cue of the category that the word belongs to if they are not able to recall them without the cue.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
